Adam Fong

Integrated Engineer - Vancouver, BC

Resume

About Me

I'm a multidisciplinary engineer with experience at an IoT startup, industrial agriculture, and academic research. My career has exposed me to a spectrum of design challenges ranging from troubleshooting mechatronic heavy equipment prototypes to designing a high precision microscopy imaging system. My design experience and first principals engineering knowledge has prepared me well to navigate through the weeds of existing and hypothesized electrical, mechanical, and software systems.

Experience

MacDon Industries

Field Engineering Technician - May 2022 - December 2022

Managed the successful operation of prototype combine harvesting headers across the USA and Canada.

  • Maintained quality relationships with and trained customers who operated our prototypes.
  • Installed, tested, and reported on prototype mechanical, hydraulic, and electrical designs.
  • Performed various field fixes to ensure maximal runtime of prototypes during the limited harvesting season.
  • Observed test machines in the field and lab, used data acquisition tools, and discussed results with engineers and customers.
product testing technical writing customer facing machine repair

MacDon Industries

Student Software Developer - January 2023 - April 2023

Developed computer vision algorithms, data acquisition systems, and collected vision data.

  • Designed and field tested a data acquisition system to synchronize, prerecord, and upload video streams with CAN trace data.
  • Implemented, collected in-situ images for, and validated a computer vision model from a recent publication.
  • Collected videos in prescribed conditions across the USA and Canada to train deep learning models.
Python OpenCV NumPy experimental design NVIDIA Jetson CAN

MacDon Industries

Student Electrical Engineer (R&D) - September 2023 - January 2024

Designed firmware and the electronics for a CAN Bus node.

  • Wrote thread safe multicore C++ and assembly language firmware for an RP2040 microcontroller.
  • Selected electromechanical sensors, power electronic components, and a compatible microcontroller for a prototype.
  • Designed a wiring diagram using KiCAD.
C++ KiCAD CAN electronics

The Temporal Ecology Lab

Undergraduate Research Assistant - January 2024 - Current

Promoted tree ring research with the development of a microscopy imaging system, image annotation tool, and sensor upgrades.
